title: Week 1: Foundation Building - Polity & CSAT Intro
description: Initiate study with foundational Polity topics and begin CSAT basics. Start the Optional Subject research process.

title: Week 2: Polity Deep Dive & Modern History Beginnings
description: Continue core Polity concepts and start Modern Indian History. Regular CSAT practice.

title: Week 3: Polity & History Integration
description: Solidify Polity and History understanding. Introduce basic answer writing for covered topics. Continue CSAT.

title: Week 4: Geography Fundamentals & Continued History
description: Introduce Indian Geography basics. Continue Modern History and Polity revision. CSAT practice.

title: Week 5: Economy Introduction & Geography Depth
description: Begin Indian Economy syllabus. Continue Indian Geography in detail. Revise Polity/History. CSAT.

title: Week 6: Economy & Environment Basics
description: Continue Economy topics. Introduce Environmental Ecology & Biodiversity. Maintain CSAT/CA. Optional subject decision should be nearing finalisation.

title: Week 7: Art & Culture Foundation & Environment
description: Begin Indian Art & Culture. Continue Environment. Revise previous subjects. CSAT.

title: Week 8: Science & Technology Intro & Art/Culture
description: Introduce basics of Science & Technology (General Science part, incl. current S&T). Continue Art & Culture. Comprehensive review of Phase 1 subjects. CSAT.

title: Week 9: Transition to Phase 2 - GS2: Governance & Social Justice
description: Shift focus to Governance aspects of GS2. Continue S&T. Begin incorporating Optional Subject study.

title: Week 10: GS2: International Relations & Social Justice
description: Focus on India & its neighbours, Intl. relations part of GS2. Continue Governance/Social Justice. Optional Subject study. CSAT.

title: Week 11: GS3: Agriculture & Food Processing
description: Introduce Agriculture related topics from GS3. Continue GS2 IR/Gov. Optional Subject study. CSAT.

title: Week 12: GS3: Infrastructure & Investment Models
description: Cover Infrastructure and Investment models from GS3. Continue Agriculture/GS2. Optional Subject study.

title: Week 13: GS3: Internal Security Basics & Disaster Mgmt
description: Introduce basic concepts of Internal Security and Disaster Management from GS3. Revise previous GS2/3 topics. Optional Subject study. CSAT.

title: Week 14: GS1: World History & Post-Independence India
description: Begin World History (Mains only) and Post-Independence India. Continue GS3 topics. Optional Subject study.

title: Week 15: GS1: Indian Society & World Geography
description: Introduce Indian Society topics (Mains only). Continue World Geography. Revise World History. Optional Subject study. CSAT.

title: Week 16: GS4: Ethics Introduction
description: Begin GS4 Ethics, Integrity, Aptitude - basic concepts and foundational values. Revise Society/World Geo. Optional Subject study.

title: Week 17: Ethics - Human Interface & Attitude
description: Focus on Ethics topics: Human Interface and Attitude. Integrate with daily life examples. Continue Optional Subject study. CSAT.

title: Week 18: Ethics - Aptitude, EI & Thinkers
description: Cover Aptitude, Emotional Intelligence, and Moral Thinkers from Ethics syllabus. Continue Optional Subject study.

title: Week 19: Ethics - Public Service & Probity
description: Focus on Public/Civil Service Values and Probity in Governance. Start introductory Essay writing practice. Optional Subject study. CSAT.

title: Week 20: Ethics - Case Studies & Revision
description: Work on Ethics Case Studies and comprehensive revision of GS4 topics covered so far. Continue Optional Subject study.

title: Week 21: Qualifying Papers & Essay Practice
description: Dedicate time to understand the pattern for Qualifying English/Indian Language papers (Comprehension, Precis, Essay basics). Continue Essay writing practice. Optional Subject study. CSAT.

title: Week 22: GS Subject Integration & Revision
description: Focus on integrating topics across GS papers (e.g., Economy & Environment, Polity & Governance). Revision of core GS subjects. Optional Subject study.

title: Week 23: Current Affairs Deep Dive & Linkages
description: Focus on linking current events with static syllabus topics across all GS papers. Optional Subject study. CSAT.

title: Week 24: Mains-Specific Topics Review & Practice
description: Intensive review and answer writing practice for Mains-only topics (World History, Society, Internal Security, IR details, Ethics, specific Eco/Gov aspects). Optional Subject study.

title: Week 25: Comprehensive Review & Mock Test
description: Comprehensive revision of all subjects covered so far. Take a full-syllabus (of covered topics) or sectional mock test covering both Prelims and Mains aspects.

title: Week 26: Ancient History & World Geography Foundations
description: Initiate study of Ancient Indian History and cover basic Geophysical Phenomena from World Geography. Continue Optional Subject and CSAT.

title: Week 27: Ancient History Deep Dive & Environment specifics
description: Continue Ancient History through Mauryan period. Cover specific environmental areas. Continue Optional Subject and CSAT.

title: Week 28: Complete Ancient History & E-governance
description: Finish Ancient Indian History. Cover E-governance aspects of GS2. Continue Optional Subject and CSAT.

title: Week 29: Medieval History Beginnings & Governance aspects
description: Start Medieval Indian History (Delhi Sultanate). Cover Citizens Charters and Accountability. Continue Optional Subject and CSAT.

title: Week 30: Mughal Empire & S&T Developments
description: Focus on Mughal period in Medieval History. Cover latest developments in S&T. Continue Optional Subject and CSAT.

title: Week 31: Complete Medieval History & Federalism Issues
description: Finish Medieval Indian History. Focus on issues related to federal structure and devolution. Continue Optional Subject and CSAT.

title: Week 32: History Revision (Prelims) & Comparative Polity
description: Revise Ancient & Medieval History from Prelims perspective. Study comparative constitutional schemes. Continue Optional Subject and CSAT.

title: Week 33: World Geography Changes & Social Sector (Health/Edu)
description: Study geographical feature changes and Social Sector management (Health, Education). Continue Optional Subject and CSAT.

title: Week 34: World Geography (Physical) & Welfare Schemes details
description: Deepen understanding of World Physical Geography and detailed study of Welfare Schemes. Continue Optional Subject and CSAT.

title: Week 35: Geography & GS2 Governance/SJ Revision (Mains)
description: Revise World Geography and delve into detailed Mains aspects of Governance and Social Justice. Continue Optional Subject and CSAT.

title: Week 36: Polity - RPA & Pressure Groups
description: Study Representation of People's Act and Pressure Groups. Continue Optional Subject and CSAT.

title: Week 37: Economy - Inclusive Growth & Resource Mobilisation
description: Focus on Inclusive Growth and Mobilisation of Resources in Economy. Continue Optional Subject and CSAT.

title: Week 38: Economy - Budgeting & Employment
description: Study detailed aspects of Government Budgeting and Employment issues. Continue Optional Subject and CSAT.

title: Week 39: Environment (EIA) & S&T Applications
description: Focus on Environmental Impact Assessment and S&T applications/achievements. Continue Optional Subject and CSAT.

title: Week 40: GS3 Comprehensive Revision (Mains)
description: Comprehensive revision of GS3 (Economy, Environment, S&T, Security, DM) from a Mains perspective. Continue Optional Subject and CSAT.

title: Week 41: Prelims Revision Phase - GS1 History/Geography
description: Shift focus to intensive Prelims-oriented revision of History & Geography. Start Prelims mock tests. Reduce Optional/Mains-only topics temporarily.

title: Week 42: Prelims Revision Phase - GS2 Polity/Governance
description: Intensive Prelims-oriented revision of Polity & Governance/Social Justice. Continue Prelims mock tests and CSAT practice.

title: Week 43: Prelims Revision Phase - GS3 Economy/Environment
description: Intensive Prelims-oriented revision of Economy & Environment. Continue Prelims mock tests and CSAT practice.

title: Week 44: Prelims Revision Phase - S&T, Art/Culture, GS
description: Intensive Prelims-oriented revision of S&T, Art & Culture, and General Science. Continue Prelims mock tests and CSAT practice.

title: Week 45: Prelims Revision Phase - Current Affairs Focus
description: Intensive Prelims-oriented revision of Current Affairs, linking to all subjects. Dedicated CSAT practice. Continue Prelims mock tests.

title: Week 46: Prelims Full Mock Test Series Begins
description: Start taking and analyzing full-length Prelims GS1 and CSAT mock tests to simulate exam conditions and identify final weak areas.

title: Week 47: Prelims Full Mock Test & Analysis
description: Continue full-length Prelims GS1 and CSAT mock tests. Focused analysis and targeted revision.

title: Week 48: Final Prelims Mock Tests & Refinement
description: Take final full-length Prelims mock tests. Refine strategy based on performance. Quick revision of crucial facts and concepts.

title: Week 49: High-Yield Prelims Revision & Mock
description: Focus on high-yield Prelims topics and current affairs. One more full mock test if needed. Solidify CSAT confidence.

title: Week 50: Final Prelims Countdown & Light Revision
description: Final quick review of key points. Light practice. Prioritize health and confidence. Minimize study in the last days.

title: Week 51: Prelims Intensive Mock Tests & Revision (GS1/GS2)
description: Focus on full-length Prelims mock tests and targeted revision based on performance, covering GS1 and GS2 subjects.

title: Week 52: Prelims Intensive Mock Tests & Revision (GS3/Current Affairs)
description: Continue full-length Prelims mock tests, focusing on GS3 and comprehensive Current Affairs revision. Intensive CSAT practice.

title: Week 53: Final Prelims Mock Tests & High-Yield Revision
description: Take final full-length Prelims GS and CSAT mock tests. Focus on high-yield topics, factual revision, and confidence building.

title: Week 54: Prelims Countdown - Targeted Revision & Rest
description: Targeted revision of weak areas identified in mocks. Quick factual brush-up. Prioritize rest and mental preparedness in the days leading to the Prelims exam.

title: Week 55: Post-Prelims Transition & Mains Assessment
description: Analyze Prelims performance (informally). Briefly review Mains syllabus again. Begin planning the Mains intensive phase. Start light Mains answer writing or revision.

title: Week 56: Mains Intensive - GS1 Answer Writing & Optional
description: Deep dive into Mains-specific topics and intensive answer writing practice for GS1. Begin serious Optional Subject revision/practice.

title: Week 57: Mains Intensive - GS2 Answer Writing & Optional
description: Deep dive into Mains-specific topics and intensive answer writing practice for GS2. Continue Optional Subject revision/practice.

title: Week 58: Mains Intensive - GS3 Answer Writing & Optional
description: Deep dive into Mains-specific topics and intensive answer writing practice for GS3. Continue Optional Subject revision/practice.

title: Week 59: Mains Intensive - GS4 (Ethics) & Essay Practice + Optional
description: Intensive practice for GS4 Ethics (theory & case studies) and Essay writing. Continue Optional Subject revision/practice.

title: Week 60: Full Mains GS Mock Test Series & Optional Intensive
description: Begin taking full-length Mains GS mock tests (GS1, GS2, GS3, GS4). Analyze performance and target revision. Intensive Optional Subject practice/tests.

title: Week 61: Mains Mock Test Analysis & Targeted Revision (GS1/GS2) + Optional
description: Analyze recent Mains GS mocks. Targeted revision and answer writing practice for weak areas in GS1 and GS2. Continue Optional Subject practice.

title: Week 62: Mains Mock Test Analysis & Targeted Revision (GS3/GS4) + Optional
description: Analyze recent Mains GS mocks. Targeted revision and answer writing practice for weak areas in GS3 and GS4. Continue Optional Subject practice.

title: Week 63: Mains Mock Test Series - Optional & Essay
description: Take full-length Optional Subject mock tests and Essay mock tests. Analyze performance and refine answer writing strategy.

title: Week 64: Mains Comprehensive Revision & Mock Tests (GS1/GS2)
description: Comprehensive revision of GS1 and GS2. Take full-length Mains Mock Tests for GS1 and GS2. Analyze and revise weak areas.

title: Week 65: Mains Comprehensive Revision & Mock Tests (GS3/GS4)
description: Comprehensive revision of GS3 and GS4. Take full-length Mains Mock Tests for GS3 and GS4. Analyze and revise weak areas.

title: Week 66: Mains Comprehensive Revision & Mock Tests (Optional)
description: Comprehensive revision of Optional Subject. Take full-length Optional Paper I and Paper II Mock Tests. Analyze and revise weak areas.

title: Week 67: Mains Countdown - Targeted Revision & Answer Structure
description: Targeted revision of challenging/high-yield Mains topics across all GS papers and Optional. Focus on answer writing structure, keywords, and current examples.

title: Week 68: Mains Countdown - Final Brush-up & Rest
description: Quick review of notes, diagrams, and key facts. Light answer writing or brainstorming practice. Prioritize rest, nutrition, and staying calm in the final week before the Mains exam.
